keyword: how many calories in bottle wine
title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in bottle wine, including a standard 750 ml serving, full nutrition breakdown, and variations for red or white types.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine, 12-13% ABV, typical serving size; values approximate for generic dry wine.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type (red/white/sweet), brand, ABV, and residual sugars. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine has about 615 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 615 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine bottle.

faqs.q: Does white wine have fewer calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar, around 585-615 kcal per bottle; dry whites may be slightly lower.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: Low for dry wines: ~6.8 g total carbs, mostly sugars, in 750 ml.

faqs.q: How does wine's alcohol content affect calories?
faqs.a: Higher ABV increases calories; 12-13% is standard at ~82 kcal per 100 ml.

faqs.q: What about calories in a glass of wine?
faqs.a: A 150 ml glass has ~123 kcal, so a bottle (5 glasses) totals ~615 kcal.
